Hello Greg,

Heritrix doesn't support POST, nor does it support the kind of link extraction you describe. 

The core reason not to support POST is that semantically POST signifies committing some action, sort of like a write, quite inappropriate for automated crawling, whereas GET is semantically like a read.

Your proposed link extraction scheme could be useful for certain forms with method="get" (though text input fields would present a problem). Feel free to put a feature request in jira: http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER

Noah

Greg Allen wrote:
> I have a couple of questions about Heritrix.
> 
> Does it support POST? For example, I want to crawl sites that have
> dropdown boxes and submit buttons. I'd like to iterate the combinations
> in the dropdown boxes (by parsing and extracting them from the HTML on 
> the page) and then POST the results back to the site, retrieving yet
> another page.
> 
> Is that something that could be done by extending Heritrix some way?
> Or does it already support this type of crawling?
> 
> Thanks!
>
